#Text=Find Your Apple ID
#Text=This wikiHow teaches you how to locate or recover your Apple ID .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Using iPhone or iPad
#Text=Open Settings .
#Text=It 's a gray app that contains gears ( ⚙️ ) and is typically located on your home screen .
#Text=Tap .
#Text=It 's at the very top of the Settings menu .
#Text=If you 're already signed in to your device and you see your name at the top instead , tapping on your name will take you to a page that displays an email address bellow your name .
#Text=That email address is your Apple ID .
#Text=If you are running an older version of iOS , instead tap and check to see if you are signed in to your device at the top .
#Text=If you are signed in you will see an email address displayed under your name .
#Text=That email address is your Apple ID .
#Text=Tap .
#Text=It 's below the password field .
#Text=If you are running an older version of iOS , instead tap
#Text=Tap .
#Text=It 's in the center of the pop-up menu .
#Text=Tap .
#Text=It 's below the " Apple ID " field .

column1: #Text=Enter your information .
#Text=Type your first name , your last name , and your email address into the labeled fields .
#Text=Tap .
#Text=It 's in the upper-right corner .
#Text=Enter your phone number .
#Text=Type in the phone number associated with your Apple ID , ending in the last two digits displayed on the screen .
#Text=Tap .
#Text=It 's in the upper-right corner .
#Text=Tap .
#Text=It 's at the bottom of the screen .
#Text=A verification code will be sent by text message to your number .
#Text=If the verification code does n't autofill , enter it on the screen and tap .
#Text=If you do n't have access to the phone number , tap Do n't have access to your trusted number ? at the very bottom of the screen and follow the on-screen prompts to recover your Apple ID .
#Text=Enter your passcode .
#Text=Enter the passcode you use to unlock your phone 's screen .
#Text=Enter a new password .
#Text=Type a password into the labeled space and re-enter on the next line .
#Text=Your password must have at least 8 characters ( including a number and an uppercase and lowercase letter ) with no spaces .
#Text=It also should n't have three consecutive characters ( ggg ) , be your Apple ID , or a previous password you 've used in the last year .
#Text=Tap .
#Text=It 's in the upper-right corner of the screen .
#Text=Tap .
#Text=If you 're not automatically signed into iCloud , enter your new password into the labeled field .
#Text=Your Apple ID will be displayed in the field labeled " Apple ID .

#Text=The screen will intermittently display the message  Signing into iCloud " as it accesses your data during the sign-in process .

column1: #Text=Enter your iPhone 's passcode .
#Text=This is the unlock code you established for your device when you set it up .
#Text=Merge your data .
#Text=If you 'd like any calendars , reminders , contacts , notes , or other data already stored on your iPhone to be merged with your iCloud account , tap Merge ; if not , tap Do n't Merge .
#Text=Your Apple ID , which is an email address , will be displayed under your name at the top of the screen .
#Text=Using Desktop
#Text=Open the Apple menu .
#Text=Do so by clicking on the black Apple icon in the upper-left corner of the screen .
#Text=Click on .
#Text=It 's near the top of the drop-down menu .
#Text=Click on .
#Text=It 's an icon containing a blue cloud on the left side of the window .
#Text=If you 're signed into your Mac with your Apple ID , your Apple ID will be the email address under your name in the left pane of the window .
#Text=If you 're not signed in , you 'll be prompted to enter your Apple ID and password .
#Text=Click on .
#Text=It 's below the password field in the dialog box .
#Text=Click on .
#Text=It 's located near the bottom of the dialog box .
#Text=Click on iforgot.apple.com .
#Text=It 's in the text of the dialog box or enter iforgot.apple.com into your browser .
#Text=Enter your information .
#Text=You will need to enter your first name , last name , and email address associated with the Apple ID .
#Text=You can enter in any prior email addresses as well , but this is n't required .
#Text=Click on Next when you 've finished filling out the form .
#Text=There is a very good chance that your Apple ID is your current email address .
#Text=Verify your birthday .
#Text=You will need to enter in your birthday before you can proceed with retrieving the Apple ID .
#Text=Choose how you want to retrieve the Apple ID .
#Text=You are given two options for retrieving your Apple ID : you can receive your login information via email , or you can answer a couple security questions and have it displayed in your browser .
#Text=If you choose to have the information sent to your email , it will be sent to your current email address as well as any other email addresses you have associated with the account .
#Text=If you choose to answer security questions , you will be asked two of the questions you set up when you created the ID originally .
#Text=Reset your password .
#Text=If you chose to answer the security questions , your Apple ID will be displayed on the next page .
#Text=You will be asked to create a new password for your Apple ID .
#Text=If you asked to retrieve your Apple ID via email , you will receive an email with a password reset link .
#Text=The email address you received the message on is your Apple ID .
#Text=Video
